result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

This bond includes 15CF47 and 15CF45:  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. Report for booking.

DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendnat appeared in person. Attorney Carly Sebion appeared specially.  Reading of complaint waived.  Defense waived time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of time limits.  Defendant understood waiver.  Court finds defendant waived the time limit for the preliminary hearing.  Defendant needs to re-apply to SPD for representation.  NGP entered by the court.  PTC &STC set.  Bond set.
